data.title: The Official Devil May Cry Thread
data.meta_description:
Looking at the reviews and general fan reaction. Yeah, DMC was an awful idea. :funny:

Couldn't be happier to have to proper Devil May Cry back. :atp:
data.text:
the full story of the orginal Devil may cry series . hopefully dante's promise to his mom about Vergil come to fruition. lol they even got a famous English anime actor to narrate this top video inthe article below

16 hours ago

Learn Everything There Is To Know About The DEVIL MAY CRY Series With This Thorough Video

Devil May Cry 5 is coming out in only a couple of days, and Capcom has decided to release a thorough video that gives us the whole story of the Devil May Cry series leading up to the latest game.

Read more

3/6/2019

Filed Under: "Devil May Cry 5" Source: Devil May Cry

PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC players will finally be able to enjoy the latest entry in Capcom's acclaimed hack and slash series, when Devil May Cry 5 releases in two more days, on Friday the 8th of March.

Just a few days ago, Capcom released a short video whose only purpose was to tell the story of the Devil May Cry series thus far. Apparently, Capcom wasn't satisfied — as they decided to release yet another video in the same vein.

The latest video posted by Capcom, ahead of Devil May Cry 5's release, is a thorough revision of the main events that have happened in every single one of the previous games in the series; as a refresher for anyone who hasn't recently played the Devil May Cry series, or don't want to marathon the games ahead of Devil May Cry 5's launch.

Take a look:

A new demonic invasion has begun with the seeds of a demon tree being sown in Red Grave City. Now fully equipped with his trusty Red Queen and Blue Rose, and a new arsenal of rad robot hands thanks to his partner Nico, Nero must rise up to this new impossible task. With such insane amount of energy and destruction emanating from this surprise invasion, the stage is now set for the latest chapter of the “Sons of Sparda” saga.

Devil May Cry 5 will be available for the PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC on the 8th of March in 2019.

source: GameFragger.com: Video Game News, Reviews, Trailers and more!

20 hours ago

V Gets The Spotlight In This Awesome New Combat Video For DEVIL MAY CRY 5

With Devil May Cry 5 just around the corner, Capcom has released a new combat video that focuses on the third playable character: the mysterious V.Read more

| 3/7/2019

Filed Under: "Devil May Cry 5" Source: Devil May Cry

It's almost time, folks, as Capcom's Devil May Cry 5 will finally be releasing for the PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC tomorrow; after a very long 10-year gap that made some fans think Capcom was done with their iconic hack and slash series.

So far, Capcom has been making sure that every fan of the series gets a refresher by releasing a few videos that go over the series' main events; something that not only long-time fans will appreciate, but also newcomers to the series who may not have the time to play all of the previous titles ahead of Devil May Cry 5's launch.

Powered by Capcom's RE engine, the Devil May Cry series has never looked better, and players will be able to enjoy the game in all of its glory as they play through it as Dante of Sparda, Nero, and third new playable character V.

In order for players to get somewhat acquainted with the mysterious V, ahead of Devil May Cry 5's long-awaited release, Capcom has released a new combat trailer that sees him summoning fear with the help Shadow, Griffon, and Nightmare, his own personal pet-demons — but don't worry, he'll be gentle.

Take a look:

A new demonic invasion has begun with the seeds of a demon tree being sown in Red Grave City. Now fully equipped with his trusty Red Queen and Blue Rose, and a new arsenal of rad robot hands thanks to his partner Nico, Nero must rise up to this new impossible task. With such insane amount of energy and destruction emanating from this surprise invasion, the stage is now set for the latest chapter of the “Sons of Sparda” saga.

Devil May Cry 5 will be available for the PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC on the 8th of March in 2019.

source: GameFragger.com: Video Game News, Reviews, Trailers and more!

7 hours ago

DEVIL MAY CRY Anime Has Been Made Available For Free On The PlayStation Store

Great news for fans of the Devil May Cry video game series, as the anime has become available — completely for free — on the PlayStation Store for fans to enjoy at their leisure.Read more

Devil May Cry 5 Is Getting A Manga Focusing On V. March 10, 2019 . 11:30am

Devil May Cry 5 is getting a manga spinoff of its own, titled Devil May Cry 5: Visions of V, and it follows V as the main protagonist in a prequel to the main game.

41 comments Read >

Devil May Cry 5 Shows How Nero Has Grown Both With His Moveset And Personality . March 11, 2019 . 12:00pm

Nero has grown between Devil May Cry 4 and 5, and the latest installment reflects that in his moveset and personality.

29 comments Read >

source: GameFragger.com: Video Game News, Reviews, Trailers and more! & Siliconera - Welcome to the Unseen Side of Video Games!

As I promised .

DMC5 with Matt Walker - Keeping Capcom Relevant

19K views 4 days ago Published on 8 Mar 2019

Matt Walker, producer at Capcom, gives us the highs and lows of being in the game industry and how it feels to work on something like Devil May Cry for years.

Devil May Cry 5 - Easy Allies Review

98K views6 days ago Published on 6 Mar 2019 Subtitles

Devil May Cry 5 has some of the best combat yet seen in an action game. Written by Ben Moore Video Edited by Brandon Jones Reviewed on Xbox One X Available on PC, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One

Devil May Cry 5 Review! - Electric Playground

1.5K views 21 hours ago Published on 03/12/2019

#PlayForever #review #DevilMayCry5 Official EPN Merch is available at EPN.tv/Merch

Dante and Nero are back, and this time they've brought some new friends! Capcom has released Devil May Cry 5, but is it worth the wait? Victor Lucas has the answer in his review!

source: Easy Allies& The Electric Playground Network | EPN

I do find V a bit of a pain to get used to and I think in general too much of the combos are locked behind orb pay walls. I think the reason why it takes a while to accumulate a decent amount is because the series has introduced micro-transactions to the system.

There's a pretty simple Red Orb farm trick. You can farm 500.000 Red Orbs in literal minutes. Get all the upgrades on the Faust hat, use the gunslinger style, then head to Mission 13, and repeat the section with the 4 Flesh Pods(?) that constantly spawn enemies. Every time all Pods are destroyed, just reload your old checkpoint. You get spawned right back at the entrance and keep all the Orbs you farmed.

The game needs more unlockable costumes imo. The ex colour skins are quite meh imo. Seeing the Megaman canon makes me think it would be fun to see some Megaman skins like Megaman, X, Zero etc for Dante, Nero and company.

I'm pretty disappointed with the lack of unlockable costumes in this game. There are none, with the exception of palette swaps.

I did hear they could be considering adding another certain character to the game at some point.

I wouldn't mind seeing Trish and Lady in their own missions. Feels like they could fit right in and add their side of the story.

Yhe game needs more unlockable costumes imo. The ex colour skins are quite meh imo. Seeing the Megaman canon makes me think it would be fun to see some Megaman skins like Megaman, X, Zero etc for Dante, Nero and company.

if they still have plan's to put this on the switch I'm hoping for samus's blaster as well .

it seem's Nathan told you about the Faust hat thing which most people have been using and why cap com made that hat in the first place.

the other thing I'm looking forward to is the up coming Net flix Devil may cry anime . I'm not sure if it'll be post this event's in 5 or if it'll a retelling of this that was put together detailed of that happen prior to 5 with the voice actor that played Rukia kuski brother.

I do want to know why sparda disappeared though?. may be they can do both. oh I do want to know about this speacial project that producer / director for Castlevana Netflix anime series was talking about with this two franchise crossing over. capcom & konomi. hmmmm.
